meanings.definition: Substances produced by plants in response to infection or stress.
meanings.sent1: When the plant was attacked by pests, it released phytoalexins to protect itself.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how phytoalexins help plants fight off diseases.
meanings.sent3: The phytoalexins in the plant were like tiny soldiers ready to battle any intruders.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a battlefield, with phytoalexins standing guard against harmful invaders.
meanings.sent5: The farmer sprayed the crops with phytoalexins, creating a shield of protection around them.

meanings.definition: Phytoalexins are antimicrobial compounds synthesized by plants.
meanings.sent1: The phytoalexins in the plant acted like natural antibiotics, killing harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on phytoalexins to keep their crops healthy and free from diseases.
meanings.sent3: The phytoalexins in the plant were like tiny superheroes fighting off germs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of plants, phytoalexins were the ultimate defenders against microbial foes.
meanings.sent5: The power of phytoalexins was evident in the plant's ability to resist infections.
